body:
### Problem

I have these imaps:

```
inoremap <c-i> ctrl_i 
inoremap <Tab> tab 
```

Expected behavior: in insert mode, typing c-i and tab will print out "ctrl_i" and "tab" respectively.

With this custom vimrc, <c-i> prints out "tab" instead of "ctrl_i". That is incorrect.

```
set termguicolors

highlight Cursor guibg=#5f87af ctermbg=67
highlight iCursor guibg=#ffffaf ctermbg=229
set guicursor=n-v-c:block-Cursor/lCursor,i-ci-ve:ver100-iCursor

inoremap <C-I> ctrl_i 
inoremap <Tab> tab 
```

NOTE: I didn't compile neovim from scratch to see if the issue reproduces on latest. Should I do that? I didn't compile from scratch because this seems like a big repo, long compilation.

### Steps to reproduce

I'm on nvim 0.9.1

```
# nvim -v
NVIM v0.9.1
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.0-beta3

   system vimrc file: "$VIM/sysinit.vim"
  fall-back for $VIM: "/opt/homebrew/Cellar/neovim/0.9.1/share/nvim"

Run :checkhealth for more info
```

See the custom rc I used. `nvim -u custom.vim`

### Expected behavior

Expected behavior: in insert mode, typing c-i and tab will print out "ctrl_i" and "tab" respectively.

With this custom vimrc, <c-i> prints out "tab". That is incorrect.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.9.1

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not relevant?

### Operating system/version

Ventura 13.0

### Terminal name/version

iterm2 Build 3.4.20

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

brew install
title: setting guicursor removes differentiation between Ctrl-I and Tab
